question.title: How to get the type of the generic that it refers to
question.body:
I am using CodeModel to manipulate JAXB auto-generated classes.
The getter method of the JAXB classes return something like JAXBElement<OutputRoot>, JAXBElement<String>, etc. I'd want to generate a method in the JAXB classes which returns the OutputRoot, String, etc.

What I can't figure out how to get the internal type (OutputRoot, etc.) so I can specify it on the new method.

What I have so far is

@Override
public boolean run(Outline model, Options opt, ErrorHandler errorHandler) {
    JCodeModel m = new JCodeModel();

    for (ClassOutline o : model.getClasses()) {
        for (Entry<String, JFieldVar> e : o.implClass.fields().entrySet()) {

            JClass classOptional = model
                  .getCodeModel()
                  .ref(Optional.class)
                  .narrow( e.getValue()
                  .type().boxify() );

            String methodName = "get" + e.getKey().substring(0, 1).toUpperCase() + e.getKey().substring(1);
            JMethod method = o.implClass.method(PUBLIC, classOptional, methodName);
            JBlock body = method.body();
        }
    }  
}

Any hint please?
